Gaduh Anggaran Aneh APBD DKI: Dari Ketertutupan dan Ketergesaan
01 Nov 2019, 06:49 by Fransisco Rosarians Enga Geken, Dwi Arjanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta -Sejumlah anggota Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat Daerah (DPRD DKI) dan pegiat keterbukaan anggaran kembali mendesak Pemerintah Provinsi DKI Jakarta untuk membuka semua rincian Rancangan Anggaran Pendapatan dan Belanja Daerah (APBD) 2020.
Anggota Fraksi Partai Solidaritas Indonesia di DPRD DKI, William Aditya Sarana, mempertanyakan alasan pemerintah Jakarta menunda penayangan dokumen Rancangan Kebijakan Umum Anggaran dan Prioritas Plafon Anggaran Sementara (KUA-PPAS) 2020 alias plafon anggaran di situs web apbd.dkijakarta.go.id.
Menurut dia, keputusan itu justru membuka peluang bagi masuknya usul program janggal dengan anggaran yang tak masuk akal.
William menerangkan, DPRD hanya punya kesempatan terbatas untuk menyisir usulan anggaran senilai Rp 85 triliun tersebut, yakni hingga 30 November mendatang. “Kami memerlukan bantuan masyarakat,” kata dia, Kamis, 31 Oktober 2019. “Kalau di-publish setelah disepakati dengan DPRD, akan percuma karena sudah sah.”
Dengan pembahasan KUA-PPAS yang dilakukan secara maraton, menurut William, program-program janggal berpotensi besar lolos karena keterbatasan waktu dan kelelahan anggota Dewan. “Anggota DPRD jumlahnya sedikit, waktunya mepet,” ujarnya.
Fraksi PSI, kata William, telah berulang kali meminta salinan dokumen Rancangan APBD 2020 ke Badan Perencanaan dan Pembangunan Daerah (Bappeda) DKI Jakarta.
Dokumen tersebut baru diberikan Bappeda pada 16 September lalu. Itu pun hanya berupa susunan anggaran hingga level kegiatan, tanpa rincian komponen anggarannya. Permohonan PSI meminta semua rincian komponen anggaran belum ditanggapi hingga saat ini.

Strange Budget Budget of DKI Regional Budget: From Coverage and Rushness
01 Nov 2019, 06:49 by Fransisco Rosarians Enga Geken, Dwi Arjanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - A number of members of the Regional Representative Council (DPRD DKI) and budget openness activists again urged the DKI Jakarta Provincial Government to open all the details of the 2020 Regional Budget and Revenue Budget (APBD).
A member of the Indonesian Solidarity Party faction in the DKI DPRD, William Aditya Sarana, questioned the reasons for the Jakarta government to postpone the issuance of the Provisional Budget Policy and Priority Budget Ceiling (KUA-PPAS) 2020 alias budget ceiling on the apbd.dkijakarta.go.id website.
According to him, the decision actually opened up opportunities for the inclusion of odd program proposals with unreasonable budgets.
William explained, the DPRD only had limited opportunities to comb out the proposed budget of Rp. 85 trillion, which is until 30 November. "We need community assistance," he said, Thursday, October 31, 2019. "If it is published after being agreed with the DPRD, it will be useless because it is already legal."
With the KUA-PPAS discussion being conducted in a marathon, according to William, odd programs have great potential to pass because of time constraints and fatigue of DPR members. "DPRD members are few in number, time is tight," he said.
The PSI faction, said William, had repeatedly requested a copy of the DKI Jakarta Regional Planning and Development Agency (Bappeda) Draft 2020 budget document.
The document was only given by Bappeda on 16 September. That, too, is only in the form of a budget structure up to the activity level, without details of the budget components. The PSI request requested that all details of the budget component have not been responded to to date.
